site_number: Land Forming Part of Former Western International Market
description: Erection of a construction and demolition waste recycling facility, concrete batching plant and associated weighbridge, weighbridge office and welfare facilities, storage bays, car and HGV parking, and use of land for fleet parking. Consent sought for a temporary period of three years. (Revised plan received relocating internal access point, reducing HGV and car parking and reducing width of picking station).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The buildings and plant equipment hereby permitted shall be removed on or 
before the expiration of 3 years from the date of this decision and the land 
restored to undeveloped form or in accordance with another scheme of work 
submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 2 - No above ground works of each respective structure hereby approved shall  take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of each respective structure have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (H11930-10, H11930-100 Rev C, H11930-12 Rev A,  H11930-13 Rev A, H11930-14 Rev A and 11930-01 Rev A received on 27th March 2017, Design and Access Statement, Flood Risk ssessment, Preliminary Risk Assessment, Sustainability Statement, Air Quality Assessment (as amended on 27th March 2017), Archaeology Technical Note, Arboricultural Survey Technical Note, Ecological Appraisal, Technical Note, Acoustic Technical Report (as amended on 27th March 2017), Planning Statement and Transport Assessment received on 9 January 2017 and H11930-11 Rev F received on 22 June 2017) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building 
is used.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site full details of both hard and soft landscape works shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the ocal planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved. These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing aterial; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant). 

Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme)  

The details shall be implemented prior to the use hereby approved commencing.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site plans shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected (including rodent fencing). The boundary treatment shall be completed before the use hereby permitted is commenced.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site full details including plans and elevations of cycle parking facilities shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement of operations.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site a plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority showing full details of the parking to take place on the site. These details shall include scale and location of disabled parking spaces. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement of operations.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site the following plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority : 

 - A car park management plan. 
 - A servicing management plan 
 - A vehicle routing plan 
 - A construction management plan 
 - A plan/ details showing the spread of vehicle movements from the site demonstrating the site operates in a manner to minimise impact on the surrounding highways network 
 -  Arrangements for wheel washing 

The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement of operations.

Condition : 10 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site plans and details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority showing car, cycle, pedestrian and disabled access arrangements to be installed on the site. 

The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement the use.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site plans and details of drainage arrangements shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement of operations.

Condition : 12 - The scheme shall be undertaken in accordance with the Air Quality Assessment and Acoustic Technical Report submitted on 9 January 2017 as amended by revisions submitted on 27th March 2017.
Condition : 13 - The scheme shall be undertaken in accordance with the recommendations of the Ecological Appraisal ? Technical Note (and addendum) submitted on 9 January 2017.

Condition : 14 - Prior to the commencement of Development an Air Quality Management Plan, undertaken in accordance with the Mayor of London's Supplementary Planning Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition'  and standards pertaining to Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) within the Supplementary Planning Guidance shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The proposal shall be implemented and operate in accordance with this plan.

Condition : 15 - Prior to the commencement development a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, including details of boundary treatment and noise mitigation during the construction phase. 

The works shall be carried out as approved during construction works.

Condition : 16 - Other than in the event of emergency, the tipping and unloading of waste shall only occur within the enclosed waste tipping area identified on the approved planning drawings. No waste shall be stored outside the enclosed areas or other identified areas as shown on plan ref H11930-11 Rev F.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved details shall be submitted to demonstrate the modular office will achieve minimum energy requirements required by Building Regulations and the facility meets best practice for the sourcing of sustainable materials.

Condition : 18 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site a Dust Management Plan and a Dust Monitoring Plan shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority which shall include details of the physical and operational measures proposed to mitigate dust. Including an automated sprinkler system and dust suppression sprays. 
 
Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans for the duration of the use.

Condition : 19 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site details of measures to be adopted to control and monitor the presence of birds, vermin and other pests on the site shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented for the duration of the use.

Condition : 20 - The facility shall operate in accordance with an Operational Statement to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the use hereby approved

Condition : 21 - Prior to first use of the facility hereby approved a scheme for monitoring and  managing the facility shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include the following: 
 - Details of how noise, vibration, dust, litter, vermin, odours, particulates, fire and security management shall be monitored for the life time of the development 
 - Details on how potential disturbance relating to noise, vibration, dust, litter, vermin, odours, particulates, fire and security management shall be managed for the life time of the development 
 - An action plan for dealing with complaints that may arise as a result of the operation of the facility as best as is practical. 
 
The facility shall operate in accordance with the scheme thereafter for the lifetime of the development.
